body:
As a user of Spack I want to be able to use the new set-function / unset-function commands in tcl module files so that I can set or unset shell functions when loading them.

### Rationale

This is a [new feature](https://modules.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MIGRATING.html#new-modulefile-commands) introduced in v4.2

### Description

This feature requires Modules v4.2. It needs to be checked:
- [ ] How shell functions can be specified in `modules.yaml` 
- [ ] If we want the possibility to specify shell functions from `package.py`

For the first point we could have a look at [block scalars](https://yaml-multiline.info/) in YAML.
title: Set or unset shell functions from tcl modules
